channel.title: [508] Others can't connect
channel.description:
Others can't connect but i can. I got hamachi and i use it, The hamachi ip and 127.0.0.1 Works for me. No i don't want to portforward. Classpath is all fine but how others can connect? Is it in client.java or something?
Thanks, please help

item.title: [508] Others can't connect
item.dc:creator: @mangalover51 mangalover51
item.description:
@mangalover51 wrote:

[quote=“andrew4444, post:10, topic:333978”]Unplug your router and modem for a few hours, chances are all the settings will be erased. Re-configure your router through what’s most commonly http://192.168.1.1/ or https://192.168.1.1/ (Like me). After Re-Configuring the settings, port forward and change the password to your own, thus allowing you administrative/root access to the router control panel. To change your settings read your router manual. Also, ALWAYS CONTACT YOUR NETWORK ADMINISTRATOR OR WHOEVER IS RESPONSIBLE FOR YOUR NETWORK PRIOR TO CHANGING POSSIBLY VITAL NETWORK SETTINGS!<<< I can’t stress this enough.[/quote] you said commonly 192.168.1.1 or the same thing rite there 192.168.1.1… lol duh

Read full topic

item.title: [508] Others can't connect
item.dc:creator: @andrew4444 andrew4444
item.description:
@andrew4444 wrote:

Unplug your router and modem for a few hours, chances are all the settings will be erased. Re-configure your router through what’s most commonly http://192.168.1.1/ or https://192.168.1.1/ (Like me). After Re-Configuring the settings, port forward and change the password to your own, thus allowing you administrative/root access to the router control panel. To change your settings read your router manual. Also, ALWAYS CONTACT YOUR NETWORK ADMINISTRATOR OR WHOEVER IS RESPONSIBLE FOR YOUR NETWORK PRIOR TO CHANGING POSSIBLY VITAL NETWORK SETTINGS!<<< I can’t stress this enough.

Read full topic
